alert.note: Alert for Southern Petroleum and Southern Garfield Counties; The Little Rockies; The Lower Missouri River Breaks including the Charles M Russell National Wildlife Refuge (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 2:09PM MDT until April 06 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS TO CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT... .A strong low pressure system from Saskatchewan will continue to direct high winds through the region. This, combined with dry fuels and grasses yet to experience a green up and lower relative humidity will sustain today`s fire danger. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT FOR HIGH WINDS, DRY FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 135, 136, AND 137... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 135, 136 and 137. * TIMING...Until midnight tonight. * WINDS...From the northwest at 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 40s. * IMPACTS...a combination of dry fuels, low humidity and high winds could lead to fire runs with any starts.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Southern Petroleum and Southern Garfield Counties; The Little Rockies; The Lower Missouri River Breaks including the Charles M Russell National Wildlife Refuge
